intrinsic properties that make that historic artifact a historic artifact one of them is causality which is the
idea that you can draw a causal link from that object in the current point in time back through history so the point
in time that it was either created or touched that made it historic you can prove that it was there at that point in
time through carbon dating and that's a that's a causal link and then the second property is originality which is the
concept that that is the historic artifact and not the copy that you can buy for twenty dollars in the gift store
now what we realized was that for the first time ever a public blockchain gives you the ability to model those two
intrinsic properties in a digital form so causality becomes the mint time of an
artifact uh token in a blockchain and if you can mint that artifact close to or
when the historic event happens then that's an immutable fact and that becomes the equivalent of carbon dating
because the thing was minted when it happened um and that's the causal link the mid
time and then originality directly translates to non-fungibility so we met them as a non-fungible token and so we
